title: From Package Delivery to Movie Magic: A Belfast Animator's Journey
summary: James Carson, a Belfast-born creative, has transformed his career from delivering packages for an animation company to becoming a CG Supervisor at Sony Pictures Imageworks, where he oversees 3D computer-generated elements for major films. His portfolio includes notable works like Mulan, Spider-man: Into the Spiderverse, and Alice Through the Looking Glass, but he gained significant recognition as a key contributor to KPop Demon Hunters, a Golden Globe-winning animated film that became a global sensation. Carson aims to inspire the next generation of animators, emphasizing that the industry has expanded with new companies and advancements in artificial intelligence, offering more opportunities than ever before. He started as a runner and advanced through roles, eventually moving to Canada for job prospects. Recently, he brought KPop Demon Hunters to Belfast for a special showing at RENDR, a festival exploring film, gaming, animation, and technology, which included behind-the-scenes insights and interactive activities. Carson's story highlights the evolving landscape of animation, where dedication and adaptability can lead to impactful careers in entertainment.
